short_summary: Purchase of compressed and liquefied gases for lab use.
description: This is a modified Request for Proposal (**RFP**) tender for the purchase of compressed and liquefied gases for laboratory use. The specific goods are on an as and when required basis.
full_summary:
### Request for Proposal: Compressed and Liquefied Gases

#### Reference Number
WS4348678923-Doc4354804339

#### Tender Status
Annulé (Cancelled)

#### Request Details
Public Services and Procurement Canada is seeking a supplier for compressed and liquefied gases on an as-and-when-required basis for the operation of laboratory instruments at the Science and Engineering Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency.

#### Key Information

* **Publication Date**: December 14, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: January 24, 2024, at 14:00 EST (note: all bids submitted after this time will be declared non-responsive)
* **Regions of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contact Information**
  * Jackson Hiltz (SPAC/PSPC)
  * jackson.hiltz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Notice URL**: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18284434?extsite=MTgyODQ0MzRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

#### Contract Details

* **Contract Category**: Goods and Services
* **Trade Agreements**: This tender opportunity is open to parties from various international trade agreements, including the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA) and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).
* **Sourcing Decision Criteria**: Upon receiving complete proposals, a Lowest Price selection criterion will be used to evaluate the most cost-effective options.
* **Required Goods and Services**: Compressed and liquefied gases (Nitrogen (N2), Oxygen (O2), Helium (He), and Carbon Dioxide (CO2)).

#### Proposal Submission Guidelines
All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by January 24, 2024, at 14:00 EST. Late submissions will be declared non-responsive. All communications and proposal submissions are subject to Canada's "Harassment-free workplaces" policies. Only the most reliable, cost-effective, and operationally suitable suppliers will be considered for contract award. Any query regarding this request for proposal is to be circulated to all registered participants only, and is to be directed to the point of contact listed above. No public discussion and/or speculation of tenders or separations, or confidential proposals shall be permitted. 

***
